questions.question: An international application is published, together with the search report drawn up by the CNIPA, 18 months +1 day after the filing date (no priority claimed). The application has no more than 35 pages and 15 claims. Which statement reflects all actions the CN applicant needs to take for entry into the EP phase 25 months after the filing date? A request for early processing has been filed.
options: Complete and file Form 1200 and pay the filing fee and the search fee
Complete and file Form 1200 and pay the filing fee, the search fee and the renewal fee for the third year
Complete and file Form 1200, pay the filing fee and the search fee and appoint a representative
None of the above statements
questions.context_answer: Rule 159(1) EPC: The examination fee and designation fee must also be paid (six months after publication of search report; payment cannot be postponed to 31 months if there is a wish to enter into the European phase at 25 months).

questions.question: A European patent application was filed on 6 February 2023. The search, filing and designation fees were paid within a month of the date of filing. What is the latest point in time for withdrawing the application, if the applicant wishes to obtain a refund of the designation fee?
options: Six months after the date of mention of the publication of the European search report
Date of mention of the publication of the European search report
The designation fee was validly paid and can no longer be refunded
Date of the start of substantive examination
questions.correct_answer: Date of mention of the publication of the European search report
questions.context_answer: Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, A-X, 5.2.2: The designation fee falls due upon publication of the mention of the European search report.

questions.question: On 10 October 2024, an applicant files a request for entry into the European phase, together with a debit order, according to which the filing fee, the designation fee, the examination fee and the renewal fee for the third year are to be debited from the applicant's deposit account. It is specified that the debit order is to be executed on 18 October 2024. On the evening of 10 October 2024, the applicant notices that the renewal fee is not yet due and should not be debited from the deposit account. What is the latest point in time for revoking the order to debit the renewal fee in Central Fee Payment (CFP)?
options: 10 October 2024
17 October 2024
18 October 2024
A debit order cannot be revoked in part
questions.context_answer: OJ EPO 2024, Supplementary Publication 2, Arrangements for deposit accounts (ADA), 13.2: A debit order with a deferred payment date may be revoked in whole or in part in Central Fee Payment until one day before the date specified as the execution date at the latest.

questions.question: The applicant received a communication pursuant to Article 90(3) EPC and Rule 60 EPC, requesting them to file a designation of inventor but missed the time limit for filing a response. After expiry of the time limit, the Receiving Section issued a decision to refuse the European patent application, dated 10 October 2024. What can the applicant do to remedy the situation?
options: File a notice of appeal against the decision within four months of notification of the decision
File a request for further processing within two months of notification of the decision
File, within two months of notification of the decision, a request for re-establishment of rights in respect of the time limit for filing the designation of inventor
A, B and C are correct
questions.correct_answer: A, B and C are correct
questions.context_answer: Articles 106 and 108 EPC; Article 121(1) EPC; Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, E-VIII, 2: A notice of appeal could also be filed within two months of notification of the decision; re-establishment of rights is excluded because further processing is available.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about filing third-party observations is correct?
options: The person that filed third-party observations will be a party to the proceedings before the EPO, and the applicant is obliged to respond to third-party observations
Third-party observations must be filed in writing and may not be filed anonymously
Third-party observations are considered by the examining division only if they include a statement of the grounds on which they are based, and an official fee is paid
Third-party observations can be filed after the publication of a European patent application and must be filed in an official language of the EPO
questions.correct_answer: Third-party observations can be filed after the publication of a European patent application and must be filed in an official language of the EPO
questions.context_answer: Article 115 EPC, Rule 114 EPC; Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, E-VI. 3: Third-party observations may be filed anonymously and there is no official fee when filing third-party observations.

questions.question: You filed an international patent application on 6 June 2024, claiming the priority of a European patent application filed on 7 July 2023. You received a communication dated 25 September 2024 from the EPO acting as International Searching Authority (ISA), stating that the requirement of unity of invention has not been complied with. The ISA identifies three inventions. You are invited to pay two additional search fees. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: You must pay two additional search fees by 25 October 2024
You do not need to file a response to the provisional opinion accompanying the partial search results
If you pay two additional search fees under protest, you must pay two protest fees within the time limit
If you do not pay any additional search fees within the time limit, the international patent application will be deemed to be withdrawn
questions.correct_answer: You do not need to file a response to the provisional opinion accompanying the partial search results
questions.context_answer: Rule 40 PCT: A protest fee is due only once, and the application will not be deemed withdrawn if no additional search fees are paid.

questions.question: An international patent application filed with the EPO as receiving Office on 10 September 2024, claims the priority of a Luxembourg patent application filed on 11 October 2023. No certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application was filed at the time of filing of the international patent application. Which of the following actions can be taken to file a certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application for this international patent application?
options: Request the Luxembourg Intellectual Property Office to prepare and send a certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application to the EPO
Submit a valid DAS code (Digital Access Service) to the International Bureau to enable it to obtain a certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application
File an electronic certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application with the EPO
File a certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application with the International Bureau
questions.correct_answer: File a certified copy of the Luxembourg patent application with the International Bureau
questions.context_answer: PCT Applicant's Guide 5.070.; Guidelines for Examination in the EPO A-III, 6.7; PCT Applicant's Guide LU-Luxembourg: The LPTO does not use the DAS access code or issue electronic priority documents.

questions.question: Firm A owns a European patent, EP. Firm B filed an opposition against EP, requesting its revocation. Firm B argued that the subject-matter of the granted claims was not new in view of document D1. During the opposition proceedings, firm C filed observations under Art. 115 EPC, arguing that the subject-matter of the granted claims was not new in view of document D2. Firm A requested maintenance of the patent as granted, or maintenance in amended form, according to auxiliary request 1. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: At the end of the opposition proceedings, the opposition division decided to revoke the patent. Firm B is entitled to file an appeal against the opposition division's decision.

At the end of the opposition proceedings, the opposition division decided to maintain the patent in amended form according to firm A's auxiliary request 1 . Firm A and firm B are entitled to file an appeal against the opposition division's decision.
At the end of the opposition proceedings, the opposition division decided to maintain the patent as granted. Firm C is entitled to file an appeal against the opposition division's decision.

During the opposition proceedings, firm B withdrew its opposition. At the end of the opposition proceedings, the opposition division decided to maintain the patent as granted. Firm B is entitled to file an appeal against the opposition division's decision.
questions.correct_answer: At the end of the opposition proceedings, the opposition division decided to maintain the patent in amended form according to firm A's auxiliary request 1 . Firm A and firm B are entitled to file an appeal against the opposition division's decision.
questions.context_answer: Article 107 EPC: Both parties A and B are adversely affected and are entitled to file an appeal.

questions.question: European patent application EP-X was filed on 1 October 2020, claiming the priority of a Belgian application filed on 16 October 2019. The mention of the grant of European patent EP-X was published on 2 October 2024. The proprietor filed a request for unitary effect and was informed by communication dated 10 October 2024, that unitary effect had been registered for EP-X-C0 on the same date. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: A renewal fee still has to be paid by 31 October 2024 in respect of the 5th year for EP-X
A renewal fee is due on 31 October 2024 in respect of the 5th year for EP-X-C0
A renewal fee is due on 31 October 2024 in respect of the 6th year for EP-X-C0
No renewal fee has to be paid on 31 October 2024
questions.correct_answer: No renewal fee has to be paid on 31 October 2024
questions.context_answer: Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, A-X, 5.2.4: The renewal fee that would have been due on 31 October had to be paid for the decision to grant to be issued.

questions.question: A communication under Article 94(3) EPC, setting a four-month time limit for reply is dated 12 September 2024. The applicant receives the letter on 21 September 2024, as evidenced by the postal receipt signed by him. What is the last day for replying to the communication?
options: 13 January 2025
12 January 2025
22 January 2025
14 January 2025
questions.context_answer: Rule 126(2) EPC: The document was delivered to the addressee nine days after the date it bears, so the period expires later by the number of days by which the seven days were exceeded, i.e. 12 January 2025 + two days.

questions.question: Which functionalities or services can be accessed directly from MyEPO Portfolio?
options: A shared area with examiners, European Patent Register, filing via the EPO's online filing software eOLF
Mailbox, a shared area with examiners, replying to a communication under Article 94(3) EPC
Mailbox, patent search via publication server, a shared area with examiners
Filing via the EPO's Online Filing 2.0, patent search via publication server, Mailbox
questions.correct_answer: Mailbox, a shared area with examiners, replying to a communication under Article 94(3) EPC
questions.context_answer: https://www.epo.org/en/applying/myepo-services/interact: It is neither possible to access the European Patent Register nor to file using the EPO's legacy Online Filing software (eOLF) via MyEPO Portfolio.

questions.question: In which of the following situations does the EPO recommend using the EPO Contingency Upload Service?
options: When you submit documents after business hours
When the EPO filing systems are functioning correctly, but you encounter a technical issue at your end
When there is a system outage at the EPO that prevents document submission via the standard filing systems
When the EPO is closed due to an official holiday
questions.correct_answer: When there is a system outage at the EPO that prevents document submission via the standard filing systems
questions.context_answer: OJ EPO 2023, A50, point 20; Contingency Upload Service | epo.org: Recommended when there is a system outage at the EPO.

questions.question: Applicant Korhonen is a Finnish national resident in Finland. He filed a European patent application in Finnish and provided an English translation in time. In response to the extended European search report (EESR), Korhonen wishes to file amended claims together with a request for examination. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: Korhonen must file the amended claims in Finnish and must then provide a translation into English, in time
Korhonen is allowed to file the amended claims in Finnish if he then provides a translation into any official language of the EPO, in time
Korhonen is allowed to file the amended claims in Finnish if he then provides a translation into English, in time
Korhonen is not allowed to file the amended claims in Finnish
questions.correct_answer: Korhonen is allowed to file the amended claims in Finnish if he then provides a translation into English, in time
questions.context_answer: Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, A-VII, 3.2; Rule 3(2) EPC: The Finnish applicant is entitled to file the amended claims in Finnish, and a translation must be filed in the language of proceedings, English in this case.

questions.question: Applicants may request processing of their international application under PCT Direct by filing a letter ("PCT Direct letter") containing informal comments, aimed at overcoming objections raised in the search opinion established by the EPO for the priority application. Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
options: PCT Direct is available if the priority application is a Belgian application filed in French, which has been searched and the international application is filed in French, using ePCT-Filing
PCT Direct is available if the priority application is an EP application filed in French, which has been searched and the international application is filed in English, using Online Filing 2.0

PCT Direct is available if the priority application is an international application filed with the EPO in English, which has been searched by the EPO and the subsequent international application is filed in English, using Online Filing 2.0
PCT Direct is available on condition that amended claims are filed with the PCT Direct letter, in a single PDF document
questions.correct_answer: PCT Direct is available on condition that amended claims are filed with the PCT Direct letter, in a single PDF document
questions.context_answer: PCT-EPO Guidelines, B-IV, 1.2: Comments are required but not amendments.

questions.question: Mr Linguist filed a European patent application in Dutch and used English as language of the proceedings. When requesting unitary effect on 10 October 2024, Mr Linguist must provide a translation of the specification. Mr Linguist would like to obtain immediate registration of the unitary effect. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: Mr Linguist must provide a translation of the specification into Dutch
Mr Linguist must provide a translation of the specification into an official language of any of the 18 states to which the unitary effect extends
Mr Linguist must provide a translation of the specification into an official language of any of the 24 states that have signed the UPCA
Mr Linguist may provide a translation of the specification into Spanish
questions.correct_answer: Mr Linguist may provide a translation of the specification into Spanish
questions.context_answer: Article 6(1) Regulation (EU) No 1260/2012; Rule 6(2)(d) UPR; Unitary Patent Guide, para. 65: The translation may be in any of the 24 official languages of the EU, except English.
